text:
The lat[er|ist] releases of Cygwin have a /proc/registry file system which
allows read only access to the windows registry.  Created a patch to the ant
wrapper shell script to, if JAVA_HOME isn't set, retrieve from the registry (if
/proc/registry is available).

J.
creator: morrijr@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 2353
read JAVA_HOME from /proc/registry in Cygwin
creator: morrijr@apache.org

text:
Since this will only work for Sun JDKs, I'd rather not apply this. 

The script should now function with JAVA_HOME being set and warn appropriately.

Is there an issue setting JAVA_HOME?

creator: morrijr@apache.org
text:
No issue, I just thought that it might make things even easier for folks
comming to the ant way of building projects :)

JAVA_HOME should always take precedence over this code anyway.
